basics.name: Anu Jajodia
basics.summary: Statistics at Carleton College. Working on ML for bioacoustics at UCSD

education.institution: Budapest Semesters in Mathematics/Aquincum Institute of Technology

work.name: UC San Diego
highlights: Planned and developed a Python package for exploration of unlabeled ecoacoustic data
Engineered models for unsupervised clustering and event separation in audio data via knowledge graphs
Utilized autoencoded audio vector embeddings for knowledge discovery and latent semantic analysis
Collaborated with National Geographic and San Diego Zoo on machine learning for conservation

work.name: Carleton College/Community Action Center
highlights: Conducted demographic analysis of food bank participant records to inform policy decisions
Cleaned data and generated sample statistics for family demographics using dplyr in R
Applied linear mixed effects models to determine impact of policy changes on food consumption
Reported findings and provided actionable insights to CAC operations manager

work.name: Carleton College/Alfred Renyi Institute
highlights: Studied hyperparameter optimization in LLMs using Gaussian Processes and reinforcement learning
Conducted literature review of Bayesian Inference methods, including LoRA and Population-Based Bandits
Developed, tested, and presented prototype CNNs and LLMs
Applied kernel methods for covariance to optimize computational processes

work.name: Metis Research
highlights: Collaborated with senior analysts on Italian healthcare system efficiency improvements
Manipulated and cleaned large healthcare datasets (2+ million records) using Pandas
Developed predictive models for appointment wait times using Scikit-Learn (linear regression, random forest, SGD)
Communicated model results to supervisors using Italian language skills and Seaborn visualizations

publications.name: FishSense Mobile: A Mobile Device App for On-Deck Fisheries Management Operations

presentations.name: Engineers for Exploration San Diego Zoo Presentation
